Hispanic Children Make Up Nearly Half of Child Abuse

Reports in NYC, Yet More Foster Care Entries are Black

Based on NYC Child Welfare System demographics data in 2022.

Hispanic

Black

White

Asian

Over 90,000 reports were made to the

Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and

Maltreatment (SCR) in 2022, more than 41,000

children in the reports are Hispanic while

around 35,000 are Black.

12% of child abuse reports

are handled through Collaborative

Assessment, Response, Engagement

& Support (CARES), an alternative

approach to investigative measures.

More than half of child abuse reports

are deemed unsubstantiated by CPS.

27% of child abuse reports become

subjects of an indicated investigation.

Less than 3% of reported cases result

in children entering foster care.

1,197 Black children in foster care

947 Hispanic children in foster care

134 White children in foster care

73 Asian children in foster care

Hispanic Children Make Up Nearly Half of Child Abuse

Reports in NYC, Yet More Foster Care Entries are Black

Based on NYC Child Welfare System demographics data in 2022.

Over 90,000 reports were made to the

41,000 children in the reports are Hispanic

while around 35,000 are Black.

are handled through Collaborative

Assessment, Response, Engagement

& Support (CARES), an alternative

approach to investigative measures.

are deemed unsubstantiated by CPS.

27% of child abuse reports become

subjects of an indicated investigation.

in children entering foster care.
